intro: Thymus leucostomus, commonly known as the white-throated thyme, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, featuring small, oval-shaped leaves with a gray-green hue. Its flowers are usually pink to purple, arranged in dense clusters, and bloom in late spring to early summer. Thymus leucostomus is often used in Mediterranean gardens for its ornamental value and mild, aromatic scent.
